H4853.def: literally: lifting up (one's) self; hence: = action by which humans turn to (other) humans with the confidence that they will find joy and comfort there

H5002.def: = action by which humans or deities make a prophetic statement; in the case of a deity this is usually done through the mouth of a prophet or seer

H384.def: = man; ◄ son of {L:Jeshaiah<SDBH:יְשַׁעְיָה>}; ► ancestor of {L:Sallu<SDBH:סַלּוּא>}, tribe of {L:Benjamin<SDBH:בִּנְיָמִן>}, after exile

H401.def: = man; ► addressed by {L:Agur<SDBH:אָגוּר>} son of {L:Jakeh<SDBH:יָקֶה>}, wise man

H595.def: = referent to the speaker or writer in a discourse

H1198.def: = state in which someone lacks intelligence, refinement and culture

H998.def: = state in which someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

H120.def: = human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between {L:male<SDBH:זָכָר>} and {L:female<SDBH:נְקֵבָה>}; ≈ associated with mortality

H3925.def: = process by which humans or animals acquire knowledge or skill from an identified or unidentified source, ► which usually results in a specific behavior or skill

H2451.def: = state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

H1847.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H6918.def: = state in which a deity differs from humans and other deities in that he cannot be associated with anything that is in any way profane or tainted by sin or other impurities, which is a quality that he desires to see in everything else as well

H4310.def: = a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

H5927.def: = process by which a substance or other object appears to move up by itself

H8064.def: = the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day

H3381.def: = process by which objects move (involuntarily) from a place that is relatively high in elevation to a relatively lower place

H622.def: = process by which humans come together from different places and form a group for a common purpose, such as for a meeting or for war

H7307.def: = an invisible being that is in a direct relation to and under control of God and one of his manifestation, often described as a substance that can be poured out, ► through whom the universe is created and animated; it can manifest itself as an invisible force equipping humans with wisdom, skill, and strength for specific tasks; it can also manifest itself as a movement of air through the bodies of animate creatures (breath) or through nature (wind)

H2651.def: = two hands joined together in the shape of a bowl; ◄ part of the human body

H4325.def: = water as the indispensible liquid on which the existence of all life depends, used for drinking, preparing food, washing, irrigating, etc.; found under the earth, on the earth, and above the earth; sometimes used as a euphemism to denote certain body liquids; ≈ associated with abundance and refreshment, but also with instability, and danger, etc.

H8071.def: = a long, flowing outer garment reaching to the feet; it was generally a loose-fitting cloth that was draped around the body and held in place in the middle by a sash wrapped around the waist or some means of fastening such as pins or buttons; it was worn at all levels of society, including also priests and other religious leaders; it served more purposes than just an outer covering; women sometimes carried bowls or other implements or grain in its folds; for poorer people it also served as a covering when sleeping

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H4100.def: = a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

H8034.def: = one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H565.def: = words spoken by humans and deities; often remembered and recorded

H433.def: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H6884.def: = action by which humans or deities examine the character of humans by having them engage in a certain activity, ◄ as a goldsmith tests the quality of a precious metal by smelting it in the fire

H4043.def: = a flat, usually round, object; made of wood or metal; ► used in battle; held by a warrior in front of him as protection from the weapons of his opponent; relatively small and easy to maneuver; ≈ associated with protection and therefore often used as an epithet for God

H2620.def: = action by which humans and animals who find themselves in difficult circumstances go to a certain location, ► in order to find protection or safety

H3254.def: = action by which humans or deities add to an existing number of entities

H3198.def: = action by which someone with judicial authority settles a dispute between two parties

H3576.def: = action by which a human or deity says or reveals something that is not true

18.gl: to prove someone to be a liar

H8147.def: = state in which a countable entity is two in number

H854.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H4513.def: = action by which humans or deities are unwilling to give or sell something to (other) humans

H2962.def: = a marker pointing to the time preceding a particular point in time

H4191.def: = process by which humans or animals stop living, either spontaneously or as a result of an act of aggression

H7723.def: = state in which humans are not committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions

H3577.def: = state in which something that has been said is not truthful

H7368.def: = state in which humans or objects are located in a place that is at a relatively great distance from the point of reference

H7389.def: = state in which humans lack sufficient means to live at a standard that is considered normal; ≈ sometimes associated with laziness or foolishness, but ultimately determined by God

H6239.def: = state in which humans possess an abundance of valuable goods, ≈ which is usually associated with a high status and considered a blessing from God

H2963.def: = action by which a person or animal is cut up and killed with one's claws and/or teeth ► for food or in order to enlarge one's territory; ≈ associated with terrifying and deadly viciousness

H3899.def: = a staple food ◄ made from a dough of water and either wheat or barley then baked; ► together with water considered the very basis of life, often used to refer to food in general

H2706.def: = specific actions required by somebody in authority

H7646.def: = process by which someone's desire for food is fulfilled

H3584.def: = process by which humans lose body volume ◄ as a result of sickness or fasting

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H4310.def: = a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H3423.def: = process by which humans gain ownership of land and other possessions, which often implies that these possessions will be passed on to the next generation

H1589.def: = action by which humans secretly take possession of objects belonging to someone else, and sometimes even of other humans, without permission or legal right and usually without intending to return it

H8034.def: = one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H3960.def: = action by which humans speak bad about alleged faults they find with other humans

H5650.def: = man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God

H113.def: = man who is in a position of authority over another person or object as a legal owner, employer, husband, or sovereign; or a person or deity who is referred to as such in a conversation or prayer

H7043.def: = state in which animals and objects have the ability to move or act with speed ◄ due to lack of weight, agility, strength, training, or energy

H816.def: = state in which humans bear the responsiblity for an unlawful deed, that was committed either knowingly or unknowingly

H7043.def: = state in which animals and objects have the ability to move or act with speed ◄ due to lack of weight, agility, strength, training, or energy

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H1.def: = direct male progenitor; ► who normally provides protection, care, instruction, and discipline; ≈ is usually regarded with respect and associated with wisdom, security, and comfort

H1288.def: = causative action by which humans cause animals to fall on their knees

H517.def: = direct female progenitor; ≈ associated with affection and loyalty; often extended figuratively to refer to other objects that are regarded as feminine

H2889.def: = state in which an object is free from dirt, contamination and everything else that is not supposed to be present

H7364.def: = causative action by which humans or animals wash (part of) their own body or someone else's body or another object, usually with water, ► in order to remove any dirt; ≈ the resulting cleanness often symbolizes ritual cleanness, innocence, or even holiness

H6675.def: = excrement; ◄ produced by humans; ► source of pollution and impurity; ≈ regarded as filthy and therefore associated with sinfulness

H4100.def: = a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

H5375.def: = process by which an object increases in height

H6079.def: = the folds of skin ► that cover the eye when closed

H2719.def: = sharp object; ◄ made out of iron or flint; ► used as tool for various purposes

H4973.def: used in poetry only: = large, sharp {L:teeth<SDBH:שֵׁן>} of an animal; ≈ associated with aggression

H3979.def: = small blade with a handle, ► used for cutting meat and other food; ≈ associated with aggression

H398.def: = action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

H6041.def: = a class of people who are suffering, often because of poverty but also because of an oppressive external situation; ≈ associated with humility

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H34.def: = person who does not have the means to provide for himself/herself, economically or otherwise, and therefore depends on help from other people and God

H120.def: = human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between {L:male<SDBH:זָכָר>} and {L:female<SDBH:נְקֵבָה>}; ≈ associated with mortality

H5936.def: = a worm-like creature that lives in streams, swamps, or damp ground; its specialized mouth makes small cuts in the skin of its victims, which may be humans, animals, reptiles, or fish, after which it fastens itself firmly on to the surrounding skin and gorges itself on blood; ◄ Limnatis nilotica; ≈ associated with greed

H8147.def: = state in which a countable entity is two in number

H1323.def: = direct or indirect female offspring of humans or animals, either biologically or through adoption

H3051.def: = causative action by which humans transfer the possession of an object to someone else

H7969.def: = state in which a countable entity is three in number

H7646.def: = process by which someone's desire for food is fulfilled

H702.def: = state in which a countable entity is four in number

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H1952.def: = a large quantity of valuable resources, ownership of which affects the way people think and live

H7585.def: = abode of the dead, a place of darkness and silence, located deep in the earth and inaccessible, where there is neither compassion nor wisdom; ≈ regarded as a place that is never satisfied; often personified; going there before one's time is considered a punishment

H6115.def: literally: closure of womb; hence: = state in which a woman is unable to conceive

H7356.def: = state in which humans feel compassion for others, ◄ caused by affection for that person and/or the lack of well-being of that person; ► this feeling is usually translated into action

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H7646.def: = process by which someone's desire for food is fulfilled

H4325.def: = water as the indispensible liquid on which the existence of all life depends, used for drinking, preparing food, washing, irrigating, etc.; found under the earth, on the earth, and above the earth; sometimes used as a euphemism to denote certain body liquids; ≈ associated with abundance and refreshment, but also with instability, and danger, etc.

H784.def: = state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H1952.def: = a large quantity of valuable resources, ownership of which affects the way people think and live

H3932.def: only used in poetry; = action by which humans or deities express their disdain of others with words, sounds and/or gestures

H1.def: = direct male progenitor; ► who normally provides protection, care, instruction, and discipline; ≈ is usually regarded with respect and associated with wisdom, security, and comfort

H936.def: = state in which someone considers someone or something else unworthy of attention or respect, and shows that by his/her actions

H3349.def: = a state in which humans are willing to obey someone in a position of authority

H517.def: = direct female progenitor; ≈ associated with affection and loyalty; often extended figuratively to refer to other objects that are regarded as feminine

H6158.def: = a large black bird with a thick strong beak, and fairly short legs; it is highly intelligent and seems to enjoy flying; it eats almost anything, including grain, fruit, insects, lizards, frogs, eggs, nestlings, and the meat of dead animals; ► unclean and therefore not to be eaten; ≈ its black color is regarded as beautiful

H5158.def: = a relatively steep and narrow valley following the course of a stream, which is often dry, except for the rainy season

H5365.def: exact meaning unsure; literally: to dig out: = causative action by which a condition inflicts an excruciating pain on someone's body (literally: bones)

H5404.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = a grouping of large birds of prey with keen eyesight; ► unclean and therefore not to be eaten; ≈ associated with large size and great strength, ability to fly great distances at high speed; symbol of protection, metaphor for God, but also symbol for death in battle

H398.def: = action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

H7969.def: = state in which a countable entity is three in number

H6381.def: = state in which an event is out of the ordinary, inspiring amazement, and usually associated with the supernatural

H702.def: = state in which a countable entity is four in number

H3045.def: = process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H5404.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = a grouping of large birds of prey with keen eyesight; ► unclean and therefore not to be eaten; ≈ associated with large size and great strength, ability to fly great distances at high speed; symbol of protection, metaphor for God, but also symbol for death in battle

H8064.def: = the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day

H5175.def: = long legless reptile without eyelids or external ears; it moves by wriggling or gliding; some species have a poisonous bite; ≈ symbol of lurking, unexpected danger; associated with lies, deception, and misleading teaching

H6697.def: = hard stony material ◄ that forms the crust of the earth, sometimes exposed on the surface, sometimes hidding under the soil; ≈ associated with hardness, permanence, and security

H591.def: = boat ◄ of a relatively large size ► that is able to sail the sea or ocean

H3820.def: = the organ located in the centre of the human body that pumps the blood through our circulatory system, ≈ seen as the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief

H3220.def: = a large and deep body of water which collects in a depression of the land; containing either salt water or fresh water

H1870.def: = an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives

H802.def: = woman of marriagable age or older, whether married or not

H5003.def: = action by which married humans have voluntary sexual intercourse with other humans who are not their spouse; ≈ often used as a metaphor for treachery or idolatry

H398.def: = action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

H4229.def: = causative action by which humans clean or dry an object or body part by rubbing it with a cloth or with their hands; sometimes extended to refer to God; ≈ sometimes associated with destruction

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H6466.def: = action by which a person or deity carries out some purposeful activity, in order to create something or cause something to happen

H7969.def: = state in which a countable entity is three in number

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H7264.def: = process by which humans or objects shake involuntarily; ◄ typically as a result of fear, insecurity, shock, excitement, or other emotions

H702.def: = state in which a countable entity is four in number

H3201.def: mostly used in a negated clause; = state in which an activity cannot be carried out, as a result of a lack of skill, strength, or ability of the agent, or other circumstances that make the activity impossible

H5375.def: = process by which an object increases in height

H5650.def: = man who is under the authority of someone else as that person's legal property, employee, subject, or vassal; or someone who presents himself as such when speaking to someone of importance or praying to God

H4427.def: = state in which humans or deities are in a position of royal authority over a group of people

H5036.def: = foolish person who has no respect for God or his fellow human beings but thinks highly of himself

H7646.def: = process by which someone's desire for food is fulfilled

H3899.def: = a staple food ◄ made from a dough of water and either wheat or barley then baked; ► together with water considered the very basis of life, often used to refer to food in general

H8130.def: = state in which humans or deities experience hostility towards a person, an object, or a practice

H1166.def: = action by which someone exercises authority over other people

H3423.def: = process by which humans gain ownership of land and other possessions, which often implies that these possessions will be passed on to the next generation

H1404.def: = woman who is in a position of authority over another person as a legal owner, employer, or sovereign

H702.def: = state in which a countable entity is four in number

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H2449.def: = state or process by which humans, deities, and animals possess or gain a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

H2450.def: = state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency

H5244.def: = small dark brown insect; its underground nest holds a queen ant, workers, and soldier ants that protect the nest; ant is capable of carrying many times its own weight; ◄ Messor semirufus or Harvester ant; ► symbol of diligence, hard work, and wisdom

H5794.def: = state in which a person, animal, substance, or force has the ability to exert great force

H3559.def: = state in which an object is firmly and immovably located in a certain place

H3899.def: = a staple food ◄ made from a dough of water and either wheat or barley then baked; ► together with water considered the very basis of life, often used to refer to food in general

H7019.def: = hot season of the year, opposite of {L:חֹרֶף<SDBH:חֹרֶף>}; ► time when most crops are harvested and preparations are made for the cold season; ≈ sometimes associated with excessive heat and drought, and also with hard work

H8227.def: = Syrian Rock Hyrax; animal with small round ears, no visible tail, and short legs, lives on leaves and herbs; two of their front teeth develop into small tusks; can run up almost vertical rock faces and climb trees with ease; ◄ procavia capensis syriaca; ► unclean animal; ≈ associated with small size and wisdom

H6099.def: = state in which humans or animals are numerous and therefore potentially powerful

H7760.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H1004.def: = construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction

H697.def: = six-legged, winged insect that is characterized by the fact that its third pair of legs is elongated and adapted to hopping; insects of this type move in swarms at certain periods and migrate to new areas, which they colonize; at other times they live either solitary or in small groups; ◄ Acrididae family; ► normally eaten cooked by toasting, grilling, frying, or broiling, though in some places they are also eaten raw; clean animal, that may be eaten

H369.def: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non-existant

H4428.def: = supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

H3318.def: = action by which humans, animals, or objects leave a certain place or position

H2686.def: = action by which insects divides themselves into orderly groups ◄ like an army

H8079.def: = small type of lizard about 10 centimeters (4 inches) long with pads at the end of its toes with small hairs, enabling it to walk upside down on ceilings and overhangs; only type of lizard that produces sound; ◄ Hemidactylus turcicus, or a general word for all kinds of gecko; some varieties of geckos are often found inside buildings; ► feeds on insects; unclean animal and therefore not to be eaten

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H1964.def: = a building or set of buildings, distinguished from other constructions or houses by its magnificence ► and function, which is either religious or political

H4428.def: = supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

H7969.def: = state in which a countable entity is three in number

H3190.def: = causative action by which humans cause objects to be in a better state of maintenance than before

H6806.def: = action by which humans put one foot before the other in order to move forward; ≈ often used figuratively to denote someone's journey through life

H702.def: = state in which a countable entity is four in number

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H3918.def: = male {L:lion<SDBH:אֲרִי>} ≈ seen as a strong and fearless animal

H1368.def: = a human being, animal, or supernatural being who is renowned for his characteristics, such as physical strength, power, bravery, skill, wealth, good character, or a combination thereof

H929.def: often used as collective: = general term for any land animal, as opposed to {L:humans<SDBH:אָדָם>}, {L:birds<SDBH:עֹוף>}, {L:reptiles<SDBH:רֶמֶשׂ>}, {L:insects<SDBH:שֶׁרֶץ>}, and {L:fish<SDBH:דָּג>}

H7725.def: = action by which humans face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H2223.def: literally: narrow waisted; exact meaning unsure; possibly: = male variant of a dark, brownish red fowl, with orange-red neck hackles, a smallish red comb on the top of their heads, and red lappets on each side under the beak; they have a white spot on their backs near the base of their long glossy black and green tails

H4975.def: = the two sides of the body of humans and certain animals between the rib cage and the hips, ► which is the place where people normally tie a girdle, breeches, loincloth, or sackcloth; ≈ a symbol of strength

H176.def: = particle linking two entities by which X and Y are alternative options that exclude each other

H8495.def: = a fairly small, male domestic animal, usually black and with floppy ears, hooves and relatively short hair, and usually found in one single {L:flock<SDBH:צֹאן>} with sheep; ► raised for its meat, and skin; a clean animal and therefore to be eaten

H4428.def: = supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity

H510.def: meaning unsure, possibly to be read as two distinct words אל קום; hence: = state in which no one dares to oppose someone

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H5034.def: = process by which plants and their products become devoid of moisture, and therefore lose color and bend over ► which may ultimately result in death if circumstances do not change; ≈ associated with drought and destruction, often as punishment from God

H5375.def: = process by which an object increases in height

H2161.def: = action by which deities or humans put together a plan or strategy to act on; often in a bad sense

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H4330.def: = causative action by which humans put pressure on {L:milk<SDBH:חָלָב>} by agitating it in a churn in order to produce {L:curds<SDBH:חֶמְאָה>}

H2461.def: = white fluid; ◄ secreted by women and female mammals; ► for nourishment of their children or young; also used as food for humans; ≈ highly appreciated and considered high quality food; associated with delight, whiteness, purity, wealth, and well-being; metaphor for beauty, young age; quality, wealth, and sex

H3318.def: = action by which humans, animals, or objects leave a certain place or position

H2529.def: = coagulated substance; ◄ formed by action of acids on milk; ► made into {L:cheese<SDBH:חָרִיץ>} or eaten as food; ≈ regarded as choice food and therefore often associated with prosperity; because of the smoothness of this substance it is sometimes associated with flattery and untrustworthiness as well

H639.def: = the two external openings in the nose

H1818.def: = red liquid that circulates in the arteries and veins of humans and animals; ► used in rituals such as sacrifices, purification and covenant ceremonies, and never to be eaten; ≈ regarded as the seat of {L:life<SDBH:נֶפֶשׁ>}; human blood, when flowing from the body, pollutes the body and the land

H7379.def: = state of opposition or hostility between two or more persons, perhaps even involving a deity
